titleInfo.title: 1839 Jul. 7, Mouth of Sweet Water [to] Mr. Cha[rle]s F. Welcker, Roane County, Ten[nessee]

mods.note: This document is a letter dated July 7, 1839, from Albert S. Lenoir to his brother-in-law Charles F. Welcker in Roane County, Tennessee. Lenoir writes to inform Welcker that Ellick, a slave he had hired from Welcker was found to have left his clothes behind in a hollow log as he had seemingly departed from Lenoir`s property. Lenoir states that he wishes to flog Ellick, but asks Welcker his opinion on the matter.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.
